meanings.definition: To allow to enter; grant entry
meanings.sent1: The kind teacher admits the students into the classroom every morning.
meanings.sent2: The security guard admits visitors into the building after checking their IDs.
meanings.sent3: The door admits the sunlight into the room, making it warm and cozy.
meanings.sent4: The key finally admits the lock's request to turn and open the door.
meanings.sent5: The gate admits only those with the secret code, keeping intruders out.

meanings.definition: To acknowledge the truth or existence of
meanings.sent1: She admits that she was wrong about the answer to the math problem.
meanings.sent2: He admits the beauty of the sunset as it paints the sky in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent3: The cat admits defeat when the dog catches the toy first during playtime.
meanings.sent4: The mirror admits the reflection of the person standing in front of it.
meanings.sent5: The scientist admits the importance of conducting experiments to learn new things.

meanings.definition: To confess to be true or to be the case
meanings.sent1: The suspect admits to stealing the cookies from the jar.
meanings.sent2: She admits her love for chocolate by always having a stash in her drawer.
meanings.sent3: The child admits to being the one who broke the vase while playing ball indoors.
meanings.sent4: The student admits to forgetting about the homework assignment due today.
meanings.sent5: He admits to feeling nervous before giving a speech in front of the class.
